  • Method Details

    • createInMemory

      public static Derby createInMemory()

    • restoreInMemory

      public static Derby restoreInMemory​(String folder)
      Restores an in-memory database from a backup folder.

    • fromDataDir

      public static Derby fromDataDir​(String name)
      Creates or opens a database with the given name in the default database folder.

    • isDerbyFolder

      public static boolean isDerbyFolder​(File folder)
      Returns true if the given folder is (most likely) a Derby database by checking if Derby specific files and folders are present; see the Derby folder specification: http://db.apache.org/derby/docs/10.0/manuals/develop/develop13.html

    • getDatabaseDirectory

      public File getDatabaseDirectory()
      Returns the Derby database directory (see http://db.apache.org/derby/docs/10.0/manuals/develop/develop13.html). The name of the directory is equal to the database name.

    • getFileStorageLocation

      public File getFileStorageLocation()
      Returns the folder '_olca_' within the database directory. If this folder does not exist is created when this method is called.
      Specified by:
      getFileStorageLocation in interface IDatabase

    • setFileStorageLocation

      public void setFileStorageLocation​(File fileStorageLocation)
      Set the location where files of data that are not stored directly in the database should be saved (e.g. external files of sources). Typically, this is only set by in-memory databases as for file based databases it defaults to the `_olca_` folder within the database directory.

    • close

      public void close()
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable

    • createConnection

      public Connection createConnection()
      Description copied from interface: IDatabase
      Creates a native SQL connection to the underlying database. The connection should be closed from the respective client.
      Specified by:
      createConnection in interface IDatabase

    • getEntityFactory

      public jakarta.persistence.EntityManagerFactory getEntityFactory()
      Description copied from interface: IDatabase
      Returns the entity manager factory from the database.

    • delete

      public void delete() throws Exception
      Closes the database and deletes the underlying folder.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • dump

      public void dump​(String path)
      Creates a backup of the database in the given folder. This is specifically useful for creating a dump of an in-memory database. See https://db.apache.org/derby/docs/10.0/manuals/admin/hubprnt43.html Note that the content of the folder will be overwritten if it already exists.
